newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France makes no net drain at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France makes no net drain at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France made no net drain or injection at a securities repurchase tender held on Thursday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Friday.
It accepted bids for 46.0 billion francs in new liquidity, the same amount leaving the market on Friday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on August 1.
The Bank of France said it allocated 14.1 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 4.3 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 31.9 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 13.0 percent of this demand.
